data.title: Vesta M. Roy
data.text:
Career

After initially being rejected in the United States for being too young, Roy crossed the border and served the Royal Canadian Air Force from 1943 to 1945 during World War II, and was named Leading Air Woman.[1][2][3] She then took a job with Prudential Insurance Company as a Special Agent. In 1974, She also became the first woman to serve as Rockingham County Commissioner.[4] Roy became a member of the New Hampshire House from 1972 to 1973 as a member of the Republican Party.[1] She was a delegate to the New Hampshire Constitutional Convention.[2] Roy served as a state senator from 1978 until 1986.
